About:
I am a graduate Computer Science Engineering student at the KULeuven. My main interests are programming languages, distributed systems and artificial intelligence.
Follow @TheAxeC

Axel Faes
Computer Science Student at KULeuven

I am a Computer Science Engineering student at the KULeuven. My specialisation in my masters is Artificial Intelligence and Theoretical Computer Science. My main interests include programming languages, distributed systems and artificial intelligence.

I am also a big supporter of open source software. A lot of the projects I made are available on Github.

Experience

Web performance research intern
Hasselt University
July 2016 - Sept 2016

I work on the iMinds PRO-FLOW project.

My work involves creating multiple usecases to measure website performance. The main focus is on the difference between the http versions (http1.1, https, http2).

    Projects

    ical-kuleuven
    September 2016

    An nodejs application to create an iCalender file for courses at KULeuven.

    Machine learning techniques for flow-based network intrusion detection systems
    Hasselt University
    Feb 2016 - July 2016

    The thesis gives an overview of how machine learning algorithms could be used for intrusion detection using only IP Flows.

    • TTUI: Household Survival
    Hasselt University
    Sept 2015 - Dec 2015

    Project made for the class 'Technologies and Tools for User Interfaces'.
    A tower-defense style game.

    Score: 18/20
    A top-3 submission for the Student Design Competition of CHI 2016
    Team members:
  • Brent Berghmans
  • Axel Faes
  • Matthijs Kaminski

    • Cardinal: scripting language
     Jan 2015 - Sept 2015

    Cardinal is an extension from ThunderdogScript. It uses Wren as the base VM and adds a couple extra features. This was done to learn more about how programming languages are made. New aspects include a early version of a debugger, an embedding API, new types and new language features such as multiple inheritance and a reimplemented module system.

    PSOPV: Visual Programming IDE
     Hasselt University
    Feb 2015 - July 2015

    A Visual programming IDE created by Axel Faes & Matthijs Kaminski for a course of Hasselt University.

    The purpose of the IDE is to create "black boxes" which can send events (signals packed with data) to eachother. We take the idea of using drag-able blocks in a visual IDE and expand on it.

    Our score was 17/20.
    Team members:
  • Axel Faes
  • Matthijs Kaminski

    • United in Manchester
    The University of Manchester
    July 2015 - Aug 2015

    A summer school which focuses on teamwork in cross-cultural and multidisciplinary teams, global product development and entrepreneurship. Our team developed a start-up idea on Food Management/Delivery system. Product pitch took place at the end of the course for feedbacks from professionals and for potential commercialisation.
    Team members:
  • Axel Faes
  • Linh Chi Evelyn Phan
  • Reinaert Van de Cruys
  • Maria Barouh
